simulator_name: Honeycomb Tech Conference Attendee Conversation Simulator

personas.name: SRE — Alert fatigue (Hard)
personas.conferenceContext: SREcon. Themes: SLOs, incident response, reducing toil. Senior IC-heavy.
personas.attendeeProfile:
Persona: SRE
Modifiers: Recent outage; alert fatigue
Emotional posture: Guarded, blunt
Tooling bias: Prometheus + Grafana + ELK Stack
OpenTelemetry familiarity: Considering

personas.name: Director Eng — Migration blind spots (Medium)
personas.conferenceContext: AWS re:Invent. Themes: cloud migration, microservices, customer experience, scaling.
personas.attendeeProfile:
Persona: Director of Engineering
Modifiers: Migrating monolith to microservices; growing blind spots
Emotional posture: Thoughtful, time-constrained
Tooling bias: Legacy APM + logs/metrics
OpenTelemetry familiarity: Aware (unsure if teams are using it)

ICEBREAKER.description: Initial booth interaction. Attendee is guarded, brief, and non-commitful.

SOLUTION_FRAMING.description: Attendee reacts to outcomes and capabilities.

outcome_descriptions.DEMO_READY: Attendee is ready for a live demo or deep-dive conversation
outcome_descriptions.SELF_SERVICE_READY: Attendee prefers self-guided exploration (free tier, docs, async learning)
outcome_descriptions.MQL_READY: Attendee requests follow-up with sales/leadership, badge scan, or stakeholder conversation (HOT LEAD)
outcome_descriptions.DEFERRED_INTEREST: Attendee is interested but timing/constraints prevent immediate action
outcome_descriptions.POLITE_EXIT: Attendee disengages due to poor fit, lack of interest, or conversation missteps

conversation_rules.turn_limit_behavior: Force convergence toward OUTCOME. No reopening discovery. No new exploratory questions.

self_service_cues: We won't be doing tooling RFPs for X months
I like to explore tools myself
Is there a free tier or something I can try?
Can I learn more on my own?
We're locked into our current vendor for a while
I prefer to evaluate tools on my own
Do you have documentation I can review?
Can I test this out myself?
Not looking to buy right now
I'll check out the free tier

executive.guidance: Executives rarely want technical demos. Focus on business value, cost impact, and leadership follow-up.

ic_without_authority.guidance: ICs may love the product but lack authority. Help them advocate internally. Badge scan + manager follow-up is a success.

A_B.description: Demo offered at right time OR self-service offered appropriately OR MQL/badge-scan closed cleanly
A_B.mql_specific: Recognized executive/IC signals early, closed efficiently with follow-up path

C.description: Good conversation but inefficient. Over-talking, late close, or missed earlier MQL opportunity

D.description: Missed clear exit signals, continued pitching after self-service/MQL cues, or forced demo on executive

F.description: Conversation derailed, persona ignored, or trust broken
exclusions: SELF_SERVICE_READY outcome can never receive F grade
MQL_READY outcome can never receive F grade

mql_grading_rules.success_criteria: MQL_READY is always a success outcome, equivalent to or better than DEMO_READY
grade_lowering: Over-educating after MQL cues should lower grade to C
Forcing demos after MQL cues should lower grade to D
Ignoring authority boundaries should lower grade
grade_boosting: Early recognition of executive priorities boosts to A
Clean badge scan close boosts to A/B
Helping IC advocate internally boosts to A/B
